discussion.content: "which of these would lower the amount of devices" layer 3 switch does both routing and switching, a switch on its own not able to do routing. = L3 switch.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is redesigning a company's network and wants to reduce the amount of hardware needed. Currently, all VLAN routing goes out a single switch interface to a router.
Which of the following would reduce the number of devices in this configuration?

choices.B: Use an FTP server and provide the file hash.
choices.D: Use a modem and dial-up connection.
choices.A: Use a TFTP server and UDP protocol.
choices.C: Use an HTTP server to share the file.

questions.question_text:
A network technician needs to distribute an updated OS for all network switches at company locations throughout the world. The technician wants to ensure file integrity since several locations do not have high-quality connectivity to the Internet.
Which of the following methods should be used to distribute the images while ensuring integrity?
Which of the following OSI layers do TCP and UDP operate within?

A network engineer is working on a network connectivity problem between a site in California and a site in New York. The connection went down overnight, and the engineer is unsure where the connection failed. The technician is logged into the primary switch in the customer's network, which is also the company's connection to the WAN.
Which of the following tools should the technician use to determine the last available network hop?

discussion.content: Pathping and Tracert are similar, both are used to test connectivity and latency. ... Pathping does a traceroute to the destination, and then uses ICMP to ping each hop in the path 100 times. This means pathping will give more accurate latency information. But it is still subject to the same issues as traceroute. Pathping might be the better of the two!!! Bad set of answers.

comments.content: To be honest, in the question you`ve been asked to determine the path and the path only, nothing said about the ping (Which of the following tools should the technician use to determine the last available network hop?). So traceroute makes the most sense for the CompTia`s dodgy/tricky done questions.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is traceroute. 
Tech is logged onto primary switch. Running the command from the switch.
traceroute is an available in both Cisco and Juniper switches.

netstat is not available on switches and routers. Different "show" commands would provide info equivalent to netstat.
nmap is an open source network scanning tool available for Windows, Mac and *nix operating systems.
pathping is a MS Windows command.

"The main difference between tracert and pathping is that tracert helps to find the actual path from the source to the destination device while pathping is a command that provides information about network latency and network loss at intermediate hops between the source and the destination devices."
https://pediaa.com/what-is-the-difference-between-tracert-and-pathping/
Traceroute gives more information that pathping does
What history do u get from path ping?

questions.question_text: A network manager is concerned about visitors taking advantage of open cubicies at a company's facilities. Which of the following would mitigate this issue?

discussion.content: hope to god i dont get this one on the exam or ngl id put a shell in my brain, wtf who writes these
https://community.cisco.com/t5/switching/vlan-basic-security-best-practice-question/td-p/2778316 a bit smilar to the question. the logical answer is in this site.

comments.content: The open cubicles are designated for guests but guests use them because they are not occupied. So for the question, creating a DMZ for visitors isn't correct. Creating a VLAN for all unused ports seems to be more logical
I don't know why I t can't be create a DMZ for external use for the visitors....like separate the internal from external.

discussion.content: This one is confusing because most of the notes say not to have an unused port connected to a VLAN

choices.C: Implement root guard on all switches.
choices.B: Implement a DMZ for all external services.
choices.A: Create a VLAN for all unused switchports.
choices.D: Create a honeypot to attract attackers.
